Reviews.Title: “Great place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: kingkongweasel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing wrong with this place at all. There was nothing here that made us want to hang out though. That is not necessarily a bad thing!!! Cold A/C, nice staff, and average home-style breakfast. The location is great. It's within a mile from the 60+ food kiosks and about 2 miles from Luquillo Beach. Sleeping to the sound of crashing waves and a good wifi connection were the highlights.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Not a real hotel, really”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: Don't go there ever. They have roaches, no ventilation in the bathroom, no hot or cold water, no matching towels, noisy neighborhood, and the beach, what beach? Stay at a resort that is for tourists, like Embassy or Hilton.The breakfast is a joke, most hotels have a 5am to 10am breakfast with the works, but this place 8am to 10am and only 5 items to chose from.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: robinnit
Reviews.Content: the place was relatively clean and the staff was helpful. The neighborhood was a little shakey (as was most of Luquillo) but it seemed safe enough. I had hope for a nice beach by the hotel but it really was not the best for swimming. There is a nice Public beach about 1 mile to the east. The pool was very nice as was the free full breakfast. This was a good spot to stay if you want to see the rainforest as it is only 15 minutes away (don't miss) They had a good safe place to park your car.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roy M
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little place, right on the beach. Only 20 rooms or so pretty nice and quiet. Close to PR 3; easy to get in and out of the area. With fresh cooked breakfast and coffee included, the price was pretty reasonable. The standard rooms are small and simple. Nothing to brag about, but clean. Staff was very courteous. Maid service was good but didn't stock the bathroom with the correct number of towels and fresh soap every day. Cons: this part of the beach is nothing to brag about and has experienced a good deal of erosion. The gate to the beach was locked the entire time so you must drive down the road to access the beach. We love the sound of the waves at night, but beware, they are REALLY loud because the waves are so close to the building. Also the room was too bright at night. The outside hallway lights shine under the door and we had to keep turning the one next to our door off. The room also has a great air conditioner with remote, but has a really bright LED panel. We taped over that with some dark paper. No glasses or drinking cups in the room. Better bring your own. All in all, was a cool little place.

Reviews.Title: “liz and ben great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin R
Reviews.Content: The average room are waterfront view with a friendly clean warm atmosphere. The staff (William, Mariam) they go beyond the call of duty and make your stay pleasurable and enjoyable. It can go to the most expensive hotel and don't get this one on one attention you get from this hotel. They are helpful with directions and making you fell at home. They can direct you the the best restaurant in town. Their own restaurant located on the lobby is an excellent service and make the best food at a reasonable price. My second time to Puerto Rico I will definitely book my reservation at this hotel. I recommend this to anyone going to Puerto Rico they will not regret going to this hotel. I THANK everyone from Yunque Mar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: eddie m
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a great place to stay. It;s located in a residential area,very peaceful and quiet. Hotel has a Large pool and a small pool for children, Breakfast is included in the room rental price. The staff is amazing,very tentative & courteous ( make you feel at home) Hotel is located on the Beach Grounds There is also a Great restaurant located on the lower grounds of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking. Eddie Montalvo

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place very peaceful place and the view out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Chicabella8
Reviews.Content: Amazing place very peaceful place and the view out of this world!!!!

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising, spend the $$, stay at a resort.”
Reviews.Author: apinkcookie14
Reviews.Content: The average rooms are not water front, they face other buildings. They have no hot tub. You cannot walk on the beach. They charge extra for everything. Including visitors etc. I will never stay at this hotel. They have no silverware in rooms. The refrigerator leaked, the door to the balcony didn't open and they said they would fix it, never happened. They have cacaroches coming out of the fridge. It's gross. If you want a real vacation stay at a resort. I visit PR every year. This is the worst by far. Don't stay here if you have high standards for cleanliness & service. ROCHESS:( nasty.

Reviews.Title: “On the Water - Very Literally”
Reviews.Author: BirdsinParadis
Reviews.Content: Although we were there just about a year ago in April, we suspect it will still be the same quaint inn, with the ocean waves breaking against the back open lounge/breakfast room. It is in a very residential local beach community. If you are looking for luxury accommodations and surroundings - this is not for you. On the other hand, we were thrilled to find this oasis in the midst of its surroundings - we had been running around the Island and this proved to be a great chance for us to relax. We stayed 2 nights, and would have stayed longer, if time had allowed. It is a nice inn with friendly and accommodating staff, a nice swimming pool, an entertainment room, with a pool table, good hot breakfast included, and the beach practically at your feet. The room was somewhat outdated, but very clean. Our stay at Yunquemar was just what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: mc76arts
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I did not read the negative comments made by some people before staying at this hotel. I may have missed out on a wonderful week!!! Hotel Yunque Mar IS situated in a residential area, people in the area were friendly and I never felt uncomfortable walking around, I stayed there with my 12 yr old daughter and if I had felt it was unsafe I would have checked out and went somewhere else. The rooms are clean and simple. What I really loved was the sounds of the ocean and the waves crashing in. So serene and relaxing. Honestly I was surprised to see the ocean ran right up to the hotel but staff explained it is becasue of the high tides at this time of the year and that during the summer it goes down again, this is not the hotels fault of course mother nature does as she pleases and besides within walking distance you have the Blaneario beach which was excellent! But the high tides from the back of the hotel didnt turn some people away from getting into the ocean though, a man who was staying with his 10 yr old son was swimming and having a blast! I was just happy to sit next to the pool reading my book while my daughter interacted with other kids in the pool. The staff was great,very helpful and made you feel like family, I had actually thought that the staff were all family but was told " we feel and act like it but we are not related" which is always a great feeling to have when staying in a cozy place like Yunque Mar. Breakfast was good, always great to have something to wake up to...coffee is what I need most in the mornings so I was greatful to walk down from my room to the smell of Puerto Rican coffee. The hotel is also close to the Bio Bay in Las Croabas (Fajardo), ziplining and very close to golf courses and major Hotels where you can go to the casinos and of course they are just a few minutes from El Yunque Rinforest, one thing I haven't read about though are two wonderful art shops that are less than five minutes from this Hotel, if you are an art lover than I suggest you visit these shops, 90% of what they have is by local artists. The restaurant was wonderful we had a great time there the food was wonderful especially for the prices. One last thing I would like to mention is the hotel seems to be expanding in other areas such as a gazebo was being built and also they will be having some sort of convenience store and what seems to be a food stand of sorts so appearently it just keeps on getting better, I plan to go back to Puerto Rico next year and can't wait to see what changes have been made! This place might not be for prople looking for high class amenities but It fit the bill perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Near yunque & Fajardo.”
Reviews.Author: ally c
Reviews.Content: Good and decent. Rooms are bare but clean. Right on the beach (awesome) but some distance to restaurants, etc. service was good and available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Yunque Mar”
Reviews.Author: superwoman_1986
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Yunque Mar and it was a great choice for us. For a great price, it worked really well. This is not a luxury hotel and is very simple but it was spotlessly clean, with free (good) breakfast, WI-FI, and a great staff. The views was amazing and the bed was big and comfortable. The only negative I can say is that the lighting wasn't very good in the room and the shower only had warm/hot water and you couldn't really change it to colder but it was fine for us. The location is down a side street in a neighborhood and I didn't find it sketchy at all and I'm a bit of a worry wort. it just felt more like a regular neighborhood and the neighbors always waved hello to us every time we came and went to the hotel. We were able to walk along the beach to Luquillo Beach and the kiosks (probably 1.5 miles or so one way) and it was near the rain forest as well. I would highly recommend Yunque Mar for someone who wants to save money and have a different experience than a large touristy resort hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean and simpletons”
Reviews.Author: AandE888
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night while waiting to get to our vacation rental. The hotel was very easy to find,the room clean and the staff very personable. It was wonderful to go to sleep with the sound of the surf! As others have noted, this is not a five star hotel, but a very decent place for a hundred bucks. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep with your windows open”
Reviews.Author: Chris3081
Reviews.Content: This delightful find was virtually perched over the ocean, thanks in part to a beach that had nearly eroded completely away. For swimming, the big beach was nearby. Good free breakfast. Close to Bio Bay and the rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel, Even better Staff”
Reviews.Author: Boricuajc
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel late in the night ended up at the Hotel Yunque Mar by accident.First night our room's tv was not functioning and the night person was unable to resolve the problem. The next day management was informed and independently upgraded us to a beach front suite for the price of a normal room. The hotel is right on the water, even though its simple, its very clean and conveniently located to the rain forest, Farjado ferry and the Luquillo beach scene and the Luquillo kiosk food scene. We hadn't planned to but ended up staying three night at this great little hotel. Best kept secret in Luquillo

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Legrand80
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7 days here. Really liked the place. Had an oceanfront 2 BR suite for the family of 2 adults and boy/girl twin 11 year olds. Pool was fine for our needs. Ocean was right in front; went to sleep to sound of crashing waves each night. Not a beach for sunning/tanning but immediate access to fun riding waves. Luquillo beach is just down the road for that stuff. Breakfast was filling and fine. Played hoops 1/2 mile down the beach with some local kids (bought a ball at Wal-mart). It's not a 5* all inclusive type of place. Need a car and need to be willing to explore on your own. Lots to do and see within an 20 minutes of this location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, helpful staff, breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: TomiyamaGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked the Yunque Mar for a short stay, and it was a lovely stay for us. The room was clean, pretty, and had air conditioning and hot water (which is sometimes iffy in Puerto Rico). It is on the ocean (although there is no beach to lounge on directly in front of the hotel), and they serve a hot breakfast in the morning, which we really appreciated (better than cereal!). We made the short walk to Luquillo Beach and then stopped at one of the many food kiosks for a meal on the way back. The staff were friendly and helpful, letting us use the phone to book flights, calling us taxis, and getting us breakfast to go when we had to catch a taxi to the airport. We didn't have high expectations, but we were perfectly happy - everything we needed was there!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping to the ocean sounds!”
Reviews.Author: Bazinga2002
Reviews.Content: If you like the big hotel resorts, this isn't your place. If you like friendly hospitality by the locals, you'll love the Yunque Mar. It's a 15 minute walk or drive to Luquillo beach. The surf is too high in December to walk on beach at the hotel. The pool and patio/breakfast area are nice. We had five in our party and stayed in the VIP suite with a balcony overlooking the ocean. We all slept well with the crashing surf. We had some problems with the TV (no remote) but that was taken care of quickly. The staff was always ready to help. The breakfast was OK; I would have like more selection especially fruit. Our sleeping rooms were big. The living room area was sufficient to play cards and the furniture was confortable. The bath was a little tight with five people and could use some counter space (and remove the bidet). Make sure to eat at Pasta y Pueblo in Luquillo. There are only 20 seats, but it's worth the wait!

Reviews.Title: “substandard hotel beware”
Reviews.Author: pantone808
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was the worst of our week stay in Puerto Rico. This hotel is very old, rundown and not on an active beach. You can drive to a nice beach but all you get here is a small pool, mediocre food, and scary bathroom/bedding/furniture. The staff was nice enough, but the next morning the ceiling of the lobby had leaked, and no one seemed to care about the puddle in the floor. At this price point the poor quality was shocking, as we found better options in San Juan, and El Yunque. To top it off, a week later at home, both of us suffered itchy skin & bug bites (scabies?) that we are certain were contracted at this hotel. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. They need to overhaul everything.

Reviews.Title: “paradise - needs a face lift!”
Reviews.Author: fcsmom
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I have just returned from 7 nights at the Yunque Mar. We wanted to love this place; the owners expansive art collection is hung in all of the common areas of the hotel so there's a gallery feel to the place. The staff - especially William - were very helpful, as was the owner.The location offers easy access to everything we wanted to do - Luquillo Beach, El Yunque Rainforest, ferry to Culebra and Vieques, the Kiosks, wandering the beautiful coast line, a day in Old San Juan - even a drive to Ponce isn't out of the question. We met interesting people from the States, Europe and Puerto Rico; a pod of manatee were floating by one morning while we were having breakfast. There is a sweet little pool area, always a bonus at a beach hotel. This could be a little gem of a hotel. But - this place is a no, no, no! The location - this is an ocean front hotel, not beach front. The sea is crashing on the foundation of the building and atop the massive sea walls built at the base of all of the buildings in this beach area. Getting to the beach requires walking thru this grim and gritty neighborhood, out onto the highway, then back thru an abandoned ball field. The room - was sold as 'garden view'. From our first floor, we could touch the cinder block wall that was painted with pictures of plants; the actual plants were 3 or 4 palm trees planted in a 18" trough. The sliding glass door that gave access to our 'patio' had no screen so for an entire week, we had no fresh air in the room - the mosquitoes and no-see-ms virulent so not worth the risk. The beds - were new and really comfy. But the sheets were old and ill fitting so every morning we work up in a tangle of bottom sheet and on the bare mattress - no bed pads were provided. During our weeks stay, the sheets were never changed, even though we asked for this service more than once. The towels - were thread bare and tiny. We never had a face cloth or hand towel. Beach towels were frequently unavailable; clean towels were unavailable more than once. A family we met were offered a bath mat in lieu of a clean towel for their 3 year old - ridiculous. The maid service - was iffy at best. A little pile of sand left by our hiking sandals remained for the entire week; hair and a dead mosquito swam in the edge of the sink for days. The room was cleaned in a very very cursory way - and once not at all. The breakfast - was exactly the same every morning - an egg, a slice of deli ham, processed cheese slice, bread; mediocre coffee (the milk was warm though) and tang or sunny-d type orange drink. Just a few tweeks to this place could really add up - offer a piece of locally grown fruit at breakfast; expand the breakfast menu to include yogurt and cereal; squeeze real juice (at the side of the road, people are selling fresh fruit and enormous bags of oranges) locally source the coffee. Get some new linens, especially bottom sheets. Change the sheets atleast once during a week stay. Get some new towels or atleast make sure that the towels you have now are available clean each day. Put a refigerator in each room; there is not a store close enough to walk to and there is not a restaurant at this hotel; being able to have snacks and a cold beer (or cold milk for children) would add great value. This area of Puerto Rico is so beautiful, so easy for folks from the east coast of the states to visit and there are so few small hotel options here; Yunque Mar Hotel could be a fantastic find; in its present state, I would not return and would never recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “I was being really, positive despite the negative reviews on here. But it is really substandard for the bill”
Reviews.Author: sarahazzard
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write a review about the yunque mar hotel in Luquillo but I was convinced by others that everyone has a right to know what they are booking themselves into. I wasn't expecting 4 stars or even 3 for that matter but I was Â expecting something from yunque mar that resembled the family size room we booked and paid for. In actual fact the room was the same size as the others with an extra bed thrown in. To the hotels credit they supplied fairly new mattresses, shame they didn't buy new sheets that fit them. The room had remnants of hair from the previous guests and at night we found a few Â small roaches. The yunque mar toilet consistently backed up and each time my husband was directed to the plunger to rectify the issue himself. Â Â Â The yunque mar Â hotel Â make no provisions for supplying evening meals, snacks, or drinks despite having a fully functional reception room and industrial kitchen. The yunque mar owner refuses to turn on the air con in the one communal space mostly because he is stingy and has no concept of the small things that add up to making your stay really pleasant or unpleasant. The yunque mar Â hotel advertises itself as a beach front...the unfortunate Â fact is that due to coastal erosion the water butts straight up to the hotel wall which means you will need to walk along the backstreets ( with no pavements) Â and / or highway 3 before you get to a "beachÂ  front" Â Â Â The breakfast was pretty shabby. A consistent choice of scrambled eggs or fried, a piece of ham and toast, orange tang or cranberry drink on polystyrene plates. All whilst fresh oranges were sold by the bushel down the road. They Â charged us extra at the end of the stay for our child's breakfasts,(three frozen aunt jamima pancakes cooked in the microwave-) despite being booked as a family room and at no point during the stay made any mention of this additional charge. When queried they promised to rectify the charge and then charged us anyhow. Utterly dishonest! Â In fact the entire bill did not match the pricing I was given on the internet. This was a frequent complaint from quests across the yunque mar hotel! ( so if you decide Â yunque mar is still for you and you seemingly get some great deal, make sure you phone them and get written confirmation Â of it. )Â  But the dishonesty at yunque mar Â is when I decided I would review the place. My advice is to try and book the sunrise hotel. Alternatively find a villa or parador. Or stay anywhere else and just drive or get a taxi into luquillo!Â  Without a rental car you will be dependent on taxis, (I can thoroughly advise that Shawn or Keith Â herrara of luquillo taxi' s are Â honest, helpful and well priced but for this reason they are also very busy so get in touch with them early if you are not renting a car.)Â

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yujiang
Reviews.Content: At first, there is a big parking area. The staff is very friendly. They could not book the room for us initially because there was credit card issue, but when we arrived, they found the mistake and gave us a large suite because there is no standard room available. Breakfast is simple but delicious. It is close to a nice beach, although the beach is not facilitated well.

Reviews.Title: “Simple comfort at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveler2
Reviews.Content: This is a small yet pleasant inn with an awesome view of the ocean in the back. It is in a residential area of Luquillo and definitely has a small town feel to it. The ocean is literally behind the breakfast area of the hotel and a small outdoor patio adjoins it as well. The rooms are small and basic with no frills but we had comfortable beds and hot water in the bath, which is all we needed. Free breakfast was quite good with a brief choice of hot items like scrambled eggs and toast, pancakes or egg and cheese with ham sandwiches (all are made to order) plus juice/coffee/tea. The owner was there every morning to serve guests and oversee the breakfast/desk staff. Felt very much at home here and got to know a few other travelers; hence it felt more like a B&B than a hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel with great service and excellent access to the nearby beaches as well as El Yunque rainforest. William at the front desk was very helpful in particular with tips on local restaurants, the food kiosks in Luquillo, ferry service from Fajardo, nearby beaches etc. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again during a future trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! We stayed for 8 nights in the suite facing the beach. The staff is friendly, especially William. Very helpful and informative. The place is clean, the location is great. It is not fancy, but we just wanted a great view and a great location and we got both at Yunque Mar. When we come back to Puerto Rico, we will absolutely book here again. The room was comfortable for us and our three teenage kids. Breakfast was simple, but fine; again, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: Ole S
Reviews.Content: My girfriend and I stayed here for two nights - everything was just as expected, the hotel is very clean and well located right on the beach. Breakfast wasn't good, however. We skipped it the next day. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Gem on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Eve26
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and were very pleased with it. We thought it was was of good value, very clean and the location fit in well with our plans. We had a large queen sized bed in a well kept comfortable room. The staff was all enthusiastic, helpful and friendly. The hotel is very pretty and welcoming ,there is a parking lot across the street so parking was hassle free and included. The hotel is right on the beach making both early morning and evening swims and walks very enjoyable. The water was very clear and clean closer to luquillo there were some unattended lots and debris on the beach but it was easy to walk around this , this area was quite a distance from the hotel. There was a back porch right off the beach and an enclosed room with a bar next to it both double as breakfast rooms. At night it was relaxing to listen to the ocean enjoy the evening breeze and the companionship of other guests. The breakfast was made and served by a pleasant couple.We only ate breakfast at the hotel but other guests had light meals and snacks prepared for them which they enjoyed and reported were very tasty. As other reviewers have reported the hotel is in a residential area , there are no sidewalks and the streets are narrow and dark making it hard to walk around at night , but fine to do so during the day. We were about a 10 minute walk along the beach away from Luquillo Beach, where all of the kisoks are located. By car this is a a quick drive, note that all of the kiosks are not open weekdays . We enjoyed the food at many including Conga and one whose name I don't remember that had local beers on draft such as Santo Viego a refreshing stout. El Yunque Rainforest was a short car ride away so close that we went to El Yunque two days in a row -the second day just to swim and enjoy Mina Falls. Sandra was great she helped with directions and tips for getting around. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did! .

Reviews.Title: “We recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: Just look at the previous positive reviews on TripAdvisor to give you an idea of what the Hotel Yunque Mar is like. Location is perfect and the rooms are clean. We were there during the off season, so not a lot of people around. Sandra, Jaque, & Willey were very kind and made us welcome and comfortable. This is great place to decompress after driving around the island for seven days. There is a downstairs restaurant. The menu was simple but the food was great! Tips- Ask for a pool or beach view room.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable!”
Reviews.Author: Culebranaty
Reviews.Content: Its very quiet, the staff is unbelieveable, the breakfast delicious and the price pretty good. Love it..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place close to the ocean and the rainforest”
Reviews.Author: Bobo185
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Yunque Mar as part of a birding package with Birding Puerto Rico so I do not know the exact cost. I do remember looking at the prices on the back of the door and thinking they were reasonable. The rooms facing the pool were much more expensive and I really did not see why. The Hotel is located on the ocean in a residential area. There is very little sand right behind the hotel and at high tide the water is almost to the hotel steps that go down to the beach. There is a good swimming beach a mile or so downâ€¦a long walk or a short drive. The neighborhood seemed safe enough and we always went for a walk before bed. They tore down the abandoned building right next door so now there is a clean open lotâ€¦I am told it was not pretty and the hotel seemed very happy to improve their view. Check in and out was hassle free. We had a standard room which had wifi, satellite TV, a large bed, and a balcony with a couple of chairs. The entire hotel, including our room was very clean. The hotel has a basement with a pool table and a lounging area with a bar. There is another indoor/outdoor lounging area in the back facing the ocean and this is where your free breakfast is served and where you can come get ice for your room from behind the bar. The pool looked clean and well kept and there are some lounge chairs around the pool for sunning. The area out front has a nice garden area with flowers and some chairs to sit on. There is always someone there and we were able to get some beers late one night. The breakfast was basic but included a few choices. I had eggs and bacon one morning and a breakfast type sandwich the nextâ€¦both were good. The coffee could be hotter. They do not serve other meals on a regular basis. Our guide arranged for Sandra to cook us dinner one night and it was great. The main reason to stay here is the close proximity to the Rainforest and we took advantage of this for our birdwatching trips each morning. We were able to find many of the endemic birds of PR with the help of our guide Hilda Morales. I would highly recommend this hotel to birdwatchers or others that want quick access to the parkâ€¦it could also be a nice quiet get away at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “they are theives with bad service”
Reviews.Author: bahou21
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst service i have ever seen. We booked our stay 1 week before arrival and waited for confirmation of our reservation (which is needed before you show up) but it never came. The website tells you to fill out the form and wait for the confirmation...but the awful management never responds. Without the confirmation, we had to plan for last minute housing, only to find out when we returned that this hotel had charged us for our booking! we called the management 5 times to refund us and even sent a lot of emails for a refund...but have still not received it 1.5 months later. They have made every excuse from we sent you a confirmation email (which they still cannot "find") to we refunded your card (which 3 weeks later has not shown up on the card). Beware before you book with them...they might just ruin your trip in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in PR”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeRover
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to PR in Jan of '10 left me wanting MORE!! We had stayed in RIncon, the west coast and I so badly wanted to see the rainforest in the East. We had a cruise out of San Juan to NYC and only had two nights to "do" El Yunque, so I found this through TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. First I have to say people either get PR or they don't (in my opinion) When we arrived in Rincon last year, I was taken back by the trash and the lack of pride in home ownership. You have beautiful homes and beaches right next to homes that look like they have been part of a NATO airstrike. I still don't understand it, but I guess that's just the way it is. On our drive to Yunque Mar, we drove through such neighborhoods...but there, like a shining jewel, an oasis.....on the beach. Our host couldn't be any better. This is one thing that will take me back to PR...the people are so friendly and helpful...never met one rude person. If you are lost, they will gladly help you...not give you some look like you've bothered them. Anyhow, it's a great base location for the rainforest. The surf was pretty rough right outside the hotel, but just a short walk down toward the larger public beach it was calmer. WARNING tho...there is a lot of trash on the beaches. I saw this on the west side of PR also. It can be depressing if you are accustomed to pristine beaches... I really don't understand why....I'm not assigning blame to locals or tourist...It is a shame that there is no obvious attempts to clean them up or keep them clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: PR_Bride
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Hotel Yunque Mar kind of by accident. For the 2nd night of our honeymoon we had planned to stay in Fajardo - but no one had rooms available unless we were willing to spend about $200 for one night! We had just rented a beach house in Luquillo and at the other end of the street was the Hotel Yunque Mar. We called and they had a room - kind bed including breakfast for $109 a night. We knew that the neighborhood looked a little sketchy at first glance from our stay at the beach house, but we also knew that it was a perfectly safe area. The clerk at the desk was very helpful, answering all of our questions. He showed us to our room, told us how the A/C worked, and let us know the hours for breakfast. The room was very large, and had a little balcony overlooking the pool area. The bathroom was a little outdated, but very clean and functional. We had a good night's sleep and enjoyed a nice hot breakfast the next morning. The view from the breakfast area can't be beat - it's right at the water's edge. The staff agreed to keep our bags after check out while we went to explore El Yunque for a couple of hours. All in all, very friendly, clean and a great value! Oh - and the artwork throughout the hotel is pretty awesome.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nick_VTRESORT
Reviews.Content: we wanted to spend a couple of days before and after the cruise in Puerto Rico but away from San Juan. This Hotel turned out to be the perfect place to relax and spend time on the beach(es) nearby. It's a 40 Minute drive from San Juan airport, we rented a car a Thrifty which was really cheap and great for visiting the natural forest which is only a few miles away from the Hotel. The Hotel is very nice and offers a breathtaking ocean view as it is located directly on the beach. It was so great to fall asleep with the sound of waves lapping, and the rooms were clean and spacious with a/c and an ocean-view balcony. If you're in for something fancy, this would be the wrong place, but the staff are very friendly and professional and willing to help with whatever issue should occur. The pool was a bit disappointing, it looks far better on the pictures and the poolside showers did not work, but hey, with the ocean less than 20ft away why care for the pool?!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Rainforest Overnight”
Reviews.Author: jjbird13
Reviews.Content: If you're more interested in seeing the rainforest, sampling the Playa Luquillo kiosks, and not high maintenance, this place is more than adequate. We had a rental car; the Rainforest is about 10 min drive from the hotel. The kiosks are 2 traffic lights away, you {could} walk. BTW, #2,12, 21 are my favs.The hotel is right on the beach, they have a pool, free breakfast which is decent. Our room had a king size bed, balcony overlooking beach/pool, cable TV, and an A/C that would freeze you out! Shower had hot water with good pressure and the place was relatively clean. William, at the front desk, spoke perfect English, very pleasant, and very accommodating. If you want luxury, and wanna pay $250/night, go to El Conquistador; otherwise, Hotel Yunque Mar is nice find.

Reviews.Title: “Would not even stay here after paying”
Reviews.Author: chacev
Reviews.Content: We walked down the road through some vacant lots filled with trash to the only part of the useable beach, only to find the water had quite a bit of trash in it too. I did not feel safe with my wife nor my buddy who was travelling with us. I would not suggest this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, well located, with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: roostertoo
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to stay if you are looking for "fancy" accommodations. But if you value location, comfort and cleanliness you can't go wrong here. Reasonably near to San Juan (old town and great restaurants) and Fajardo (great food and ferry access to Culebra and Vieques). Adjacent to El Junque rain forest (a must see). We enjoyed the island by day and slept well at night. The next day, after breakfast provided by the hotel, we repeated the pattern for a very enjoyable week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, just the basics.”
Reviews.Author: LeiBH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute getaway to Puerto Rico for Christmas. We noticed Luquillo with one of the best-rated beaches in PR, and near El Yunque rainforest. We were worried about price and availability, but Hotel Yunque Mar offered a great price per night. We were impressed with the website and the friendly staff, so we took a chance and booked two nights. The room was very basic with a simple bed and pillows, a table, lamp, and television. We weren't feeling picky or going for luxury, and the room was clean and quiet, so we were satisfied. The only annoyance was the water pressure in the toilet kept giving us problems. We asked to use the toilet plunger multiple times, which didn't really help since it wasn't clogged, just took forever to drain. The water pressure in the shower was adequate, so we may have just been unlucky with our toilet in that specific room. Otherwise, the terrace for breakfast was beautiful, literally directly on the beach. Being winter, the waves were very strong and high, so there was no beach access directly from the hotel. The pool was refreshing, and again, the staff were friendly. I would recommend Hotel Yunque Mar to travelers who aren't going for luxury, but just need the basics. The location was perfect for our beach and rainforest adventures, and we were happy to have a safe and clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, This place is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Skyblue10_64
Reviews.Content: The owners Sandy and Edgar made sure our stay was everything we wanted it to be. They were exceptional with helping us with tour information and directions. The room was very comfortable and everything we needed for a great hotel stay, and to top it all off, we were right on the beach! My daughters and I had so much fun downstairs in the evenings where we experienced great music (some live) and free billiards. We also had cocktails and snacks and couldn't be happier with the friendly people there at Yunque Mar Hotel. The manager Willy was so friendly that we felt right at home. It was so nice eating the hot breakfast (made to order) right in front of the beautiful beach. My girls found some really cool sea shells around on the beach as well. So what if there are some damaged properties around the Yunque Mar, that doesn't take anything away from this excellent place to stay! It's quiet and convenient to various locations of interest. The only thing that I didn't care for was that the pool closed so early (at 6pm). But that was very minor and wouldn't stop me from going here to stay again. Thank you good friends at the Yunque Mar! We had such a great time thanks to you!!! Sincerely, Jeanne Breu and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: rodmat30
Reviews.Content: There are no words to say how beautiful, wonderful & delightful was the Yunque Mar. The place is beautiful. There are no words to say how wonderful the staff is. Breakfast didn't lay around, it was made fresh when you ordered it. Edgar & Willie, are the people to meet. They were wonderful people to talk to and even played pool we us. The price of the place is excellent. We are going to make this our place everytime we go to Puerto Rico. You sleep with the ocean right there, hearing every bit of it. The service, the rooms, location & amenities are super excellent. we can't fine the words to express & say how wonderful this place & the staff is. from: gringa1207@yahoo.com (Gladys & Rosey)

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: LauraVioleta
Reviews.Content: Really liked it! I am Puertorican and partial to small, less expensive hotels wherever I go. Just spent two nights at the Yunque Mar, looking for a break from difficult past two weeks. If you are afraid of strangers/locals, maybe this is not a hotel for you.This small hotel sits in the typical beach community of Playa Fortuna in Luquillo, PR. Look in Google Earth west of the Balneario. The real estate in this area is high although it is not quite developed yet. Many expensive vacation homes among native family dwellings. It is as safe as anywhere else. The Yunque Mar is family owned. Overheard it was built in 2000 to serve as a hotel, so it's architecturally pleasant. What impressed me was it's cleanliness, tasteful decoration, bright rooms and friendliness. Loved the covered terraces almost over the ocean, with its bar room where breakfast is served and an adjacent area where tables and comfortable chairs are available to relax any time of day. Owner and staff were prompt to answer any questions and offer help. This is a very basic hotel, no hair blower nor ironing board... although I imagine that asking will get you a long way. Readers bring your book light to read in bed. I didn't take my laptop but was told they have wifi at the premises. I found that my room's glass door due to the salitre (salt from ocean wind), did not lock securely but we didn't do anything about it. If it is important to you, then check this out. Free advise: dress and act low key, no jewelry, no one foot long lenses, no Gucci bagsâ€¦ this is a very informal beach community. Ask advise from the owners. I am not a swimmer, so the beach in front of the hotel, even though it is beautiful to look at and listen to, is not for me. However the Balneario de Luquillo (Balneario La Monserrate is the correct name but that name is not used much.. Link: http://www.parquesnacionalespr.com/monserrate_bal.asp is closed Mon and Tue for cars and other facilities like toilets, showers, beach chairs, but can be accessed anytime on foot for free) is less than a 30 minute walk away. We walked along the beach to the Balneario the first day but decided not to do it again because there is a place which I found dangerous to cross. There was a cement small bridge or something in the past, but it broke and I didn't want to cross through it again. Ok for the young and fearless I guess. Otherwise take other nearby inland paths or if money is no problem, drive and park at the Balneario for US$4.28 entrance fee. Loved eating at the kioskos. Learn the names for our finger foods: bacalaitos, empanadas, empanadillas, rellenos de papa, and my favorites piononos and alcapurrias... Not finger foods like mofongo, arroz with whatever, morcillas â€¦ Kioskos have good food, like kiosko #57, but music is quite noisy. There will be some kiosks open from 8am to 11pm or later in high season. Also had dinner at kiosko #1 (I think), named La Parrilla, excellent ambiance and good food but not too cheap. Check the hotel's web page. Click on the hotel facilities link and you'll see the exact photos of what I found. Not to duplicate i'll be posting some different photos I took. My GPS didn't have Playa Fortuna listed, so just in case this helps anyone: While at Yunque Mar my GPS said I was at: N 18Âº 22.889' W065Âº 44.706' Nearest intersection PR-3 E & PR-992 Luquillo, PR 00773

Reviews.Title: “Great service & very helpful staff; overall great value”
Reviews.Author: froggy054
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional; they went out of their way to help and make you feel at home. Overall the facility served very well its purpose and the beach was actually very nice. I would definitely come again and invite my friends and colleagues to use this hotel. It's actually a great value!

Reviews.Title: “The Bottom Line-- GREAT PLACE TO STAY and AFFORDABLE”
Reviews.Author: NYvero
Reviews.Content: For the budget traveler who wants to get away from San Juan, this hotel is the place to stay! Itâ€™s a small, cute spot right on the beach. The staff was incredibly friendly and went out of their way to help us find restaurants and things to do. You have access to some of the best beaches on the island and there are plenty of decent, cheap eateries specializing in seafood nearby. Best of all, this hotel is located near El Yunque Rainforest, so this is the best place to stay for anyone who wants to hike and explore the beautiful natural environment. The rooms are very comfortable, CLEAN, perfect for relaxing and having a good night sleep. The pool was just right for cooling down before grabbing some drinks and walking down the beach while enjoying the sunset. Overall, I would definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some things just look better in pictures. You'll find a better place than this.”
Reviews.Author: pull4ud
Reviews.Content: Dissapointing. For the price of the room there, which was around $150 or so (albeit split between 2 couples) was way too high given what we got. If the hotel were $60 per night, my review would be different, but I had slightly higher expectations. It's worth it if you can pay $60. Glad we only booked one night before heading to Vieques for the week. First off, I'd like to say that I thoroughly reviewed this place first on T.A. and proceeded. The neighborhood is not as bad as some people say. There are families and children. They are not rich. But, I feel it is safe, although not aesthetically pleasing. However, my problem is the hotel itself. The room was hot and beds uncomfortable. The A/C didn't work well. The bathroom wasn't great, and we had no toilet paper, which was a pain to get. The breakfast in the morning was nothing special, I'd have prefered going to a bakery somewhere instead. Pancakes were made with a mix and water. The coffee, however, was good! The hotel is waterfront, but when we arrived, all the beach access was locked. It was about 4 p.m. or 5 p.m. Next day, we checked it out and were glad they locked it at night. It's nothing great. The houses nearby have not been maintained. It's not scenic. I'm attaching pictures, but like my title suggests-- Pictures ARE MISLEADING. on the surface this place looks good, but once here and staying, you're better off elsewhere. Trust me. Feel free to message me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: nofatties13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. Pictures on website are not an accurate depiction of it's current appearance. The neighborhood around the hotel is a pretty bad area, next to the check in desk their circuit break panel was open with exposed electrical wires all over the place. Ocean view rooms are "partial ocean view" see my pics if you want to see what that means (90% view of nasty pool and neighbors rooftops, 10% ocean if you crane your neck). I have lived in a dingy college dorms and apartments for the past 4 years and this didn't live up to even my standards. There's not even cups in the room to have a glass of water, no phone, beachfront is covered in garbage-there was actually a pack of 8+ stray dogs bathing themselves on the beach when we first went out to check out the view (I wish I were kidding). It seems like management has been writing their own reviews on here I paid $109 after taxes and I just wish i could have my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Beach front in bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: discgolfbeth
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before booking and I was expecting a bit of a bad neighborhood around the hotel, but it was awful. The hotel itself is fine, but the surroundings are in really bad shape. We had no problems with safety, but I was shocked that more people didnt mention how bad it was. If you look to your left, it's a beautiful beach. If you look to your right, there's a house leaning into the ocean with a heap of trash. It was a good price for beach front and we werent there all that much to experience the hotel. The staff was really nice. The room was large, not much on decor, but large. I would REALLY recommend getting a room that faces the pool.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: liztrip_10
Reviews.Content: What a gem! This hotel is right on the ocean and is within walking distance of parks, delicious food stands, and an amazing public beach. Our hosts offered us mangoes picked right from the tree out front and cooked us breakfast that we ate just a few feet from the ocean. The rooms are a little spare, but there is no reason to spend much time indoors anyway. There is plenty of comfortable sitting space outdoors where you can enjoy ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: SparkyMom
Reviews.Content: This is a basic and very clean hotel, with a lovely pool. The beach is limited but the ocean is right there. We found a fabulous birding guide through the hotel and everyone was very friendly and helpful. Nothing fancy, but we've never had anyone scramble breakfast eggs for us at a Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough room, but not the one I booked”
Reviews.Author: intrepid42
Reviews.Content: I booked an ocean-view room for our honeymoon more than a month in advance. When we arrived, the only rooms remaining were a ground-floor pool-view and a second-floor with two full beds. Moral of the story: Call to confirm twice if you have special requests. Bright points were helpful staff, good restaurants a 5-minute drive away, and a cooked-to-order hot breakfast included. But be aware that the beach in front of the hotel is a little rough around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Yunque Mar, on the beach, at the doorstep to the El Yunque Park, Sweet”
Reviews.Author: robertocollins
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet place with friendly staff. They let me use the kitchen to heat up some left overs and gave great advice when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy for the price”
Reviews.Author: latina3383
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, Sandra was very good at giving directions. Room we stayed in let you hear the crashing waves. Footsteps away from the beach, although the waves were too rough the day we stayed. There is a pool. Conveniently located close to the Yunque and Luquillo Beach, we payed around $100 (without breakfast). Can't really complain. May go back

Reviews.Title: “wonderful very clean and SANDRA AND HER CREW ARE WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: floidabeba
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel clean and nice people working there they make you feel at home we will be back Sandra and her crew are wonderful thank you for a wonderful experience Chamaco and Liz orlando fla

Reviews.Title: “Booked it, but cancelled when we got there”
Reviews.Author: Josunae
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to find a beachfront hotel on the northeast coast, at a reasonable rate. However, when we arrived we decided to cancel our reservation after viewing the room, the beach, and the surrounding neighborhood. The room (ocean front suite with mini-kitchen) was large and had a beach-front view, but it was extremely musty and damp. We walked out to the balcony, and saw abandoned properties along the beach ~ which was littered with trash. We didn't feel we would be comforable walking on the beach in the area. While there was a nice pool on the property, we really wanted to take advantage of being on the beach. On a positive note, the owners were understanding when we cancelled. We did pay for a single night's stay which had been our deposit. We were able to find accommodations within a couple miles that had a much cleaner beach and updated, (non-musty) rooms ~ so losing the deposit at Yunque Mar was worth it to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with ocean view”
Reviews.Author: delily
Reviews.Content: This is not the greatest hotel I've ever stayed at but it was clean, quiet, reasonably priced, close to the rain forest and bio bay tour and it had the added benefit of having an ocean view balcony and air conditioning. The room had a double bed covered with only a sheet--no bedspread, there were was a table but only one chair (strange) and also only one chair on our balcony, so we moved chairs in and out a lot so that we could both sit at the same time. The hotel provided towels but no washcloths. Everything was clean and the room was adequate for a 2-night stay. The staff was very nice and helpful. It is located in a crowded residential area but has it's own parking lot across the small street. Our room overlooked the ocean plus some run-down buildings but in some ways that was a plus because it gave us a glimpse into how average puerto ricans live. It sits right on the beach and has its own pool. I had chosen the "ocean view" room instead of the "ocean & pool view" thinking that I might be getting a more direct view of the ocean. This is not the case. The ocean is on the north side of the hotel. The "ocean view" rooms look toward the west with a view of the ocean and neighboring homes. The "ocean & pool" view rooms look toward the east. You can walk along the beach to the Luquillo kiosks if you want. You can see them from the hotel, and it is probably about a 30 minute walk. I'd heard there is a restaurant here, but if there is, it wasn't in operation when we were here. Breakfast in the morning was nothing spectacular but was an adequate start to the day--a scrambled egg, toast, sausage (any maybe potatoes, I can't quite remember) plus your choice of juice. The one problem I had was with the stairs. While beautifully tiled, they are uneven. By that I mean, one might be 5" high but the next 6". Only a slight difference, but just enough to throw you off so that I tripped twice going up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For !”
Reviews.Author: omar13888
Reviews.Content: The Yunque del Mar is a great little hotel. It is not one of those mega restorts, so do not expect supper luxury. What you do get is a clean and comfortable room with AC. The breakfast was not a cruise line buffet, but enough to get you going and out the door. I feel the hotel is perfect for the traveler who wants to explore the north and east of PR. Everyday we would travel to a different location and return in the evening to a friendly and fun hotel. It was like coming back to a friend's place. They have a small bar, usually the owners, their friends, and the guest will hang out there in the evening. It was great place to enjoy their culture. One of the things I was pleasently surprised by was the art work that hangs on the walls. The art reflected the scenes of the area, they are very good. The small pool leads directly out to the beach. The beach is small, but to the left, about 400 yards is the outlet of the river from the rain forest. The next time we go to PR, I will stay at Yunque Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WestportRedPeople
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for a charming boutique on a quiet beach. We got a quiet motel on a dirty beach, at a price point that was out of synch with the room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: MomPR
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because of the positive reviews. However, even though it was on the beach and close to everything I was surprised to find the beds with no coverlets, dingy and very much used towels and the breakfast which was touted as being" a la carte" was actually a choice between a ham,egg and cheese sandwich or scrambled eggs with a hot dog. The staff is very helpful and friendly but for the price I expected a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but not the gem the website claims it to be”
Reviews.Author: tarhealer
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is not on Luquillo beach - it is in a neighborhood called Fortuna, where the beach is almost nonexistent. The water comes right up to the front of the hotel, even at low tide, so it is impossible to even get onto the beach directly from the hotel without jumping into the ocean. This being said, I've never slept that close to the waves - quite romantic at night with the balcony door open. The rooms are clean, but simple, maybe overly so for the price. Breakfast is provided, made to order, otherwise dining options are within driving distance. It is close the el yunque rain forest, which would be the main reason to stay here. Just fyi - the owner uses the hotel to throw personal parties and does not inform the guests. One does not know when the party is happening until it happens, and there is no good estimate of when the party may end.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Connecticutmom57
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my vacation in Puerto Rico and stayed at a great, small Hotel. It was close to all of the turist attractions in the area and the best surprise was it is right on the beach. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They even had a pool but the water was too cold to enjoy it. Maybe it would be in their interest to have a heated pool. The breakfast was included and I was surprised to find it was a full breakfast, homemade and delicious. The staff are very friendly and are very helpful in giving suggestions and directions to evrything from where to shop, eat, and enjoy the local entertainment. Cant wait to return anfd if you ever catch yourself there make sure to ask for Sandra, she's great!! Hasta Luego, Michelle

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, decent value. A good overall Puerto Rican experience!”
Reviews.Author: 3pointsteve
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel together with my girlfriend in two different occasions in jan 2009. Here there are my impressions; I try to be as objective as possible, but at any case, my point of view is going to be the one of an open minded european tourist in his late 20s. LOCATION: The best thing about it is probably its location, about 45 minutes away from San Juan airport and just 10 minutes away from both the El Yunque national tropical forest and the beaches at Luquillo. It is also in a quite convenient location for getting to Fajardo (ferry to Culebra, Vieques) or to the city of San Juan itself. ROOMS: The rooms where we stayed were both slightly outdated, but clean and cozy; the first one was actually not too big, whereas the second one was very roomy and comfortable. There is A/C and a small balcony in all of the hotel rooms; there's no room safe, but you can give all your valuable items to the staff which will hold them for you . Hotel is family owned and staff was nice with us all of the time, offering ice when needed, (good) advices on nearby restaurants and everything else we needed. POOL/BEACH: As some other reviewer pointed out, the pool is not to big, but nevertheless it's a nice calm place just to hang around & sun bathe or just relax. The beach in front of the hotel was also very shallow in this period of the year, but a 10 minutes walk allowed us to reach the Balneario (see pic), a very nice beach, especially suited for families, swimming (calm sea, sandy bottom) or simply relaxing. A 10 minutes drive also allowed us to reach the Luquillo town center and the "La Pared" (= "The Wall") beach, where some good wave activity and sandy bottom creates great conditions for boogie boarding and also surfing (looked to me like a great place where to start learning). PLACES WHERE TO EAT: Nearby area looks very peaceful and safe; even if the hotel lacks a restaurant, there are many options (restaurants/fast foods) available within the 5/10 minutes car ride range, so that it's hard to starve to death :-) Nearby Kioskos (see pic) can also be reached on foot in about 10 minutes. Following hotel staff suggestions, we ate at one of these, called the "La Parilla" (="The Grill") one night and lobster, as everything else we had, was delicious. Value was ok and staff was also very friendly. Then, following the owner suggestions, we also had dinner at a place called Sea King (just opposite the gas station near the cemetery, in Luquillo), but unfortunately the overall experience here hasn't been as memorable. Food was actually very good and very affordable also (great value here!). Too bad, what could've been a great dining experience for us was ruined by some completely untrained and rude waiter there. If you're lucky to have some nicer person serving you, I'm sure this can turn out into a wonderful experience. At any case, I guess the whole Luquillo area is very good for eating some great sea food. It basically won't be hard to find a place to eat. ;-) Sodas, Beers and other drinks can be purchased directly at the hotel, which also offers complimentary ice and serves a decent breakfast in the morning. VALUE: Back to the hotel, value was ok for us, but it could've actually been a little better. This is not to say I was not satisfied overall, but now I know there are some discounts on certain periods at the hotel and then the price per night definitely becomes much more interesting. Still, I think we've got what we've payed for, especially when I compare the hotel with other facilities we stayed in the Caribbeans (probably not the cheapest area in the world :-) OVERALL My girlfriend and me love to try to blend with the culture and lifestyle of the places we visit and, although we expect cleanliness, we don't have high luxury standards; my review has been written accordingly and I can say this has been a good experience for us. We might also decide to come back. sometimes in the future. Of course, if luxury is mandatory for you and you're used to big 5 star resorts, you might be probably better off looking at some other place. It's the Caribbean though, so if you're looking for cheap luxury, I'm afraid you might have better luck just heading to Vegas instead ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Basic room, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: robingrn
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Yunque Mar Hotel. The rooms are very basic, our "ocean view w/king bed" is just that. A king bed, one chair, small table, small dresser, and small bathroom. The balcony over looking the pool and the ocean was very nice. We spent some afternoon hours out there sipping cocktails and enjoying the view. The rooms were very plain (all white), but very clean. The hotel is outside of Luquillo, in a quiet neighborhood, with the hotel located right on the ocean. There is no real beach in front of the hotel, but a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel in either direction takes you to a pleasant stretch of sand. There is a lot of litter on the beach - wear shoes when walking to avoid the broken glass. Luquillo beach is just a 5 minute drive away. Luquillo beach is very pretty and clean, w/bathrooms and food stands right on the beach. The staff at Y.M. was excellent! Sandra and her crew went out of their way to help us find good food stands (the kiosks down the road have some outstanding choices), good beaches, a bank, etc. They provide a nice breakfast every morning - coffee, juice, and your choice of 3 different breakfasts. They do NOT allow coolers, so if you are planning on bringing some food in, keep that in mind. El Yunque Rain forest is a 10 minute drive away. While not as beautiful as Costa Rica, Belize, etc, it was very pretty, and with its paved paths, made for nice hikes. Bring a rain coat, hike in the rain, and you will have most trails all to yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this beach.”
Reviews.Author: iamkasiaNYC
Reviews.Content: I disagree with the previous review. I thought the property and rooms were very clean. Each room has a balcony and a hot breakfast is included for everyone staying! Eggs and ham! The management was very nice and recommended a great seafood restaurant nearby. Yes, this property is in a residential stretch and you cannot go out around, but have to take a car to go out to eat. However the beach location is superb. If you walk out on the beach and walk right 15minutes you make it to a gorgeous and public beach called Luquillo that is breathtaking... There are lots of littlekiosks selling lunch and pina coladas and the water is super calm , swimmable and beautifully turquoise. If you walk out of the hotel and go left 15 minutes, you pass a river jetting into the ocean that looks like the Amazon to me, and if you cross it you end up at the Westin, where you can use their beach! All the beaches in the PR are public. Although this hotel is essentially just a room you are paying for, it is an excellent value and if you come for the beaches you will not be disappointed. It is also right at the entrance to the rainforest and only took us 35 minutes to get back to San Juan. The only thing that I didn't like is that this whole area is very suburban like. Route 3 running next to this coast is dotted with sams clubs, kmarts, KFcs etc, which makes it lose its charms off the beach. But no question about it, this beach is gorgeous. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mrmr431
Reviews.Content: I am not a high maintenance traveler, so trust me: this place is not worth staying at. The beach access is great, everything else is awful - the rooms are run down, the food is mediocre at best, and the neighborhood has nothing but the beach. Neither the pool nor the hot tub was filled with water.

Reviews.Title: “friendly place at an moderate price”
Reviews.Author: wmsf
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star resort hotel, but I doubt that you will find another place in Puerto Rico located directly on the water that is as comfortable, and pleasant at such a moderate price. We stayed here for three nights, and it was a very convenient base for spending one day at El Yunque rain forest (much closer to Luquillo than from San Juan), and another day relaxing on Luquillo's famous beach. Our room was clean and modern with cable TV and air-conditioning. Our small terrace was on the side of the building but still afforded us a partial view of the ocean and the sound of the pounding surf. The only complaint that I have about the room is that the bathroom is dimly lit. All of the hallways and public areas of the hotel are decorated with artwork by local artists. There is a small public terrace on the second floor at the front, and at the rear is a larger terrace area and bar facing the ocean. Although we did not use the small swimming pool, it looked clean and inviting. Simple but tasty meals are served at the hotel either on the rear terrace, or in a basement dining area. (It looked a bit like a church basement, but it served the purpose.) We ate dinner at the hotel 2 of our 3 nights, and we can recommend the filet of fish. Other than the food stands along the highway, there seems to be a lack of restaurants in Luquillo, so eating at the hotel was a convenient choice. The beach by the hotel is narrow and the surf is rough. It is not a place to swim, but rather a beach for walking and getting your feet wet. Luquillo's famous beach is just a short drive down the highway from the hotel. We were impressed by the friendliness of the staff. We had a number of pleasant conversations with them during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: circlemtnlady
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Yunque Mar. The hotel is a welcome change from the typical chain hotel stay. It is located on the beach in Luquillo, where we enjoyed a great view of New Year's Eve fireworks. Our hosts were very warm and considerate, sharing a traditional holiday meal with us when we arrived late on New Year's eve. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The pool was terrific and our 9-year old had a hard time deciding which was more fun, the pool or the beach. Wonderful views and very peaceful on the terrace. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MaliaT
Reviews.Content: We were robbed of $100 from our locked room (an employee apparently) and the best the owner Edgar could offer us was to call the police. Further, this hotel is not actually in Luquillo (you have to get on a busy highway to get to the town center or the beach) and in the winter, at least, there is no beach in front of the hotel, just crashing surf and a small pool. Too bad, because we had high hopes for a pleasant and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed, not the best value...”
Reviews.Author: tbot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Yunque Mar in Luquillo after reading several positive reviews on Trip Advisor. Overall, I must be honest and say I am little dissappointed in the overall experience. We must have arrived there shortly after a storm bc it seemed that they were understaffed and in need of repairs. Both bedrooms' AC did not work and we had ask the front desk to come and fix them. The pool and hot tube was empty. The hotel was mostly vacant and the bar never opened. The tv did not have cable or satelite, not that we wanted to watch much tv, but it was another thing that we had paid for that wasn't available. We had rented a suite with a kitchenette, but there wasn't any silverware nor plates that could work with the microwave. The hotel had an amazing location and was fairly clean although my fiance complained that the beds had a lot of sand/dirt in them. I am in the hospitality business myself, so I always try to support smaller, family run guesthouses as opposed to bigger chain hotels. Although I know PR is really expensive as a whole, it did not seem like the best value. The front desk was appologetic about the problems, but only gave a 10% discount after we complained. It would have been different if we had been forwarned about the issues and given more of discount. I am sure the place is nicer than what we experienced and I hope this review helps them remmody some of these issues so other guests can have a better stay then we did. Almost $200/night doesn't seem like a great value for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Authentic Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: city-hiker
Reviews.Content: We loved the Yunquemar as an authentic experience of the best of Puerto Rico. It is a small, family-owned hotel in a small town right outside of the larger town of Luquiilo, and is RIGHT on the beach with a restaurant/bar on site. The hotel is clean and comfortable, but very simple. It is right on the ocean (so close the water laps the steps at high tide). The beach is calm and perfect (unlike that by some of the larger hotels). One morning, we were the only people on the beach; it felt like our own private paradise. The owner is very connected to local musicians and artists and the hotel is a gallery for local artists and a venue for musicians. The restaurant serves 3 meals and is a bar at night; it is right on the beach; a beautiful and fresh location right on the ocean. If you are looking for a simple, restful vacation that will give you a feeling for the island hospitality and culture, Yunquemar is perfect. We were recommended by friends to stay here and pass along the favor. It is not for anyone looking for a luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “Simplistically AMAZING!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MLM913
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a few days stay at YunqueMar in Luquillo, Puerto Rico. This place is a MUST!!!!! The food is fabulous, The ocean view is breathtaking.... Staff is very friendly and personable. Reasonably priced. They also make great mojito taino's. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Puerto Rico with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: allmotorchick
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small simple and clean hotel Yunque Mar is a great option. It's not luxury but it 's a great deal for the price. We were in Puerto Rico in April planning our wedding and we did not want to spend a lot of money on a room. There wasn't many post on Tripadvisor about the hotel so we went there and were lucky enough to get a room. The rooms were clean and right on the beach. The pool was beautiful. The prices were excellent for Puerto Rico. It's hard to find "good" deals in PR. It's a small hotel so it was relaxing. The neighbor hood around it is okay and they are trying to fix up the beach front area near the hotel. Parking is across the street and it gets tight whent he hotel is full. The hotel itself is very wasy to find and is a few blocks in from Rt 3. It's about a 45 minute drive from the airport which is due mostly to traffic. The best part was the owners. They are both very hardworkers and very friendly. Both are very invloved in every aspect of the business. We loved the restaraunt La Yola. You can't find a better deal where you can eat right on the beach in Puerto Rico We were so happy with them that we brought our entire family there for dinner when we got married in July. The chicken and fish are good and so are the appetizers and the Pina Coladas. Please feel free to contact us about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: leopoldNorthEastOhio
Reviews.Content: Staff was very courteous and friendly. Right on the waters edge and very close to the rain forest and Luquillo Beach. Although not a 5 star resort the rooms are clean and very good homestyle cooked meals are available. All the basic needs but no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent value”
Reviews.Author: lifeisbeautiful
Reviews.Content: I had great difficulty finding accomodations for below 100 in most areas in Puerto Rico. This hotel cost me around 80+$ and was the only oceanfront property I stayed in. We had a poolview room with a balcony (the pool being right below our balcony). I have no complaints about the room, location or the estabilishment. The street where the hotel is located is a semi residential area and very laid back. The pool opens up to the ocean but somehow most places lock the gates in the night. We could here the ocean from the hallway as we entered our room. The place had air conditioning. We reached around 2 AM on Christmas day and they called us and gave us instructions on reaching the property and the room. Room cleaning was on time even on Christmas day. I will stay here again but if I find a cheaper place I would go for it because this is slightly over my budget. They were also prompt in responding to reservation emails and phone calls.
